required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Serologic Response to the SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19) mRNA-1273 Vaccine in Select Subsets of Oncology Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Serologic Response to the SARS-CoV-2 mRNA-1273 Vaccine in Select Subsets of Oncology Patients - A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: To explore the immune response to the COVID-19 vaccine in cancer patients and compare to the general population.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to measure the immune response to the COVID-19 vaccine in cancer patients and compare to the general population. This information can help optimize the timing of the mRNA-1273 vaccine relative to starting treatment for cancer, adding booster immunizations or incorporation of medications that to enhance the immune response.

primary_outcome.description: Vaccine response, as determined by blood concentrations of serum IgG reactive to the RBD domain of spike protein from the original SARS-CoV-2 virus will be measured by ELISA

intervention.description: Blood sample, 2- to 5 tea spoon full (between 10 to 25 mL approximately) between 43 to 96 days after first dose of the vaccine.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects are between 50 and 75 years of age
